instructions: Tap the Input Settings button, then drag the Level slider left or right to set the input level. The Level slider is available if your input source supports software level control. To set the level automatically, tap the Automatic switch next to the Level slider. If the input device supports left and right channels, tap Left or Right to select the input channel. When you finish, tap Done.

Tap the Input Settings button Guitar Amp Input Settings button , then turn Noise Gate on. Drag the Noise Gate slider until the noise stops or decreases to an acceptable level. When you finish, tap Done.
Tap the Input Settings button Guitar Amp Input Settings button . Tap the Monitor switch to turn monitoring on. Tap the switch again to turn monitoring off. When you finish, tap Done.

Tap the Stompbox button Guitar Amp Stompbox button in the upper-right corner to show the stompboxes. To add a stompbox, tap an empty stompbox slot, then select a stompbox from the list. To replace a stompbox, tap the stompbox you want to replace, then select a new stompbox from the list. To remove a stompbox, drag it down toward the bottom of the screen. Tap the Amp button Amp button in the upper-right corner to return to the amp controls.

Tap the Stompbox button Guitar Amp Stompbox button in the upper-right corner. On iPhone 8, iPhone 7, or iPhone 6s, tap the Stompbox button Guitar Amp Stompbox button , then double-tap the stompbox you want to turn on or off. Tap the round On/Off button on the stompbox. If the small round LED (usually red) on the stompbox is lit, the stompbox is turned on. Tap the Amp button Amp button in the upper-right corner to return to the amp controls. On iPhone 8, iPhone 7, or iPhone 6s, tap the Controls button Controls button , then tap the Amp button Amp button in the upper-right corner to return to the amp controls.

Tap the Stompbox button Guitar Amp Stompbox button , then double-tap the stompbox you want to adjust. Turn the knobs to adjust the stompbox controls. Swipe left or right if you want to work on a different stompbox.

Tap an empty stompbox slot, then select Modern Wah from the list. Hold your iPhone 10 20 inches (25 50 cm) away from your face, then tap the Face Control button Face Control button . The first time you use Face Control, GarageBand asks for permission to access the camera on your iPhone. As you play, open and close your mouth to move the wah pedal up and down. You can tap the Amp button Amp button and adjust the amp controls while continuing to use Face Control. To turn Face Control off, tap the Face Control button again.

Tap the Tuner button Guitar Amp Tuner button in the upper-left corner. Play an open string you want to tune, watching the tuner. The red horizontal lines show whether the string is too low (flat) or too high (sharp). When the string is in tune, the note name in the center turns blue. Tap the Tuner button again to close the tuner.

Modify an existing amp sound by changing the amp, adjusting the amp controls, adding or removing stompboxes, or adjusting the stompbox controls. Tap the Navigation button Navigation button in the control bar, tap the Sounds button, then tap Save. Type a name for your custom sound, then tap Done. The first time you save a custom sound, a new Custom category appears, with an icon for your sound. You can rename or delete the sound by tapping Edit, then tapping the icon (to rename the sound) or the red circle (to delete the sound).
